recipe.recipe_name: Spinach and Mushroom Egg White Omelette
recipe.ingredients: - egg whites: 6 - fresh spinach: 2 cups - sliced mushrooms: 1 cup - diced onions: 1/4 cup - shredded low-fat cheese (optional): 1/4 cup - olive oil: 1 tablespoon - salt: 1/4 teaspoon - black pepper: 1/8 teaspoon
recipe.directions: 1. Prepare Vegetables: Heat the olive oil in a non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add the onions and mushrooms, and saut√© until they are soft, about 5 minutes. 2. Add Spinach: Add the fresh spinach to the skillet and cook until it wilts, about 2 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. 3. Cook Egg Whites: In a bowl, whisk the egg whites until frothy. Pour them over the vegetables in the skillet, ensuring they are spread evenly. 4. Add Cheese: Sprinkle the shredded low-fat cheese over the top if using. 5. Cook Omelette: Allow the egg whites to cook until they are set and the edges start to lift from the pan, about 4-5 minutes. Carefully fold the omelette in half and slide onto a plate.
recipe.nutrition: Total Carbohydrate: 10g, Dietary Fiber: 2g, Sodium: 400mg, Saturated Fat: 1g, Total Fat: 8g, Protein: 28g, Cholesterol: 5mg, Total Sugars: 4g
recipe.total_calories_estimation: - Total Calories for entire recipe : Approximately 301 calories for the entire recipe. - Calories for each ingredient: Egg Whites: 102 calories for 6 egg whites Fresh Spinach: 14 calories for 2 cups Sliced Mushrooms: 15 calories for 1 cup Diced Onions: 16 calories for 1/4 cup Shredded Low-fat Cheese: 80 calories for 1/4 cup (optional) Olive Oil: 119 calories for 1 tablespoon Salt, Black Pepper: Negligible - Serving People: 1
